key_title: Key to the genera of Hydrocharitaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Hydrocharitaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1994). Hydrocharitaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Male flowers with a single stamen and perianth segment; leaves with finely toothed margins, in subopposite pairs
Male flowers with 3–9 stamens and perianth segments in two whorls of 3; leaves with entire margins, or if finely toothed then in whorls
Marine plants; leaves opposite, arranged along a thin, creeping stem
Freshwater plants; leaves all basal or whorled, never in pairs
Stem and branches distinct with internodes developed; leaves whorled
Stem reduced or stoloniferous such that all leaves appearing basal
Stems floating on or suspended in water, rooted in substrate or not; some leaves with aerenchyma on abaxial surface; peduncles mostly short (less than 5 cm); plants monoecious
Stems rooted in substrate; leaves without aerenchyma on abaxial surface; peduncles mostly elongate (more than 5 cm); plants dioecious or flowers bisexual
[link through]
Leaves elliptic or narrowly ovate to suborbicular (juvenile leaves linear); flowers bisexual; stem reduced, not stoloniferous
Leaves linear; plants dioecious; stem stoloniferous
[link through]
[link through]
Leaf margin coarsely toothed with fine teeth; leaf whorls often well-spaced along branches; stamens 3; stigmas 3, threadlike and undivided
Leaf margin minutely toothed; leaf whorls moderately to densely crowded on branches; stamens 9 or 10; stigmas 3, broad distally and deeply 2–4-lobed at apex
[link through]
Leaves usually 4 or 5 per whorl, 15–30 mm long; staminal filaments at least 3 times as long as anthers; inner perianth 6–12 mm long, 2–3 times as long as outer whorl
Leaves usually 3 per whorl, 6–12 mm long; staminal filaments much shorter than anthers; perianth 2.6–5 mm long, inner and outer whorls ± equal
[link through]
[link through]
